nodes.text: The black population in Wales is over-represented by five times within the prison population of Wales
Liz SavilleRoberts : The black population in Wales is over-represented by five times within the prison population of Wales
Asserting
the black population in Wales is over-represented by five times within the prison population of Wales
Calum: Liz SavilleRoberts : The black population in Wales is over-represented by five times within the prison population of Wales
Liz SavilleRoberts : surely that is a desperate failure
Rhetorical Questioning
the over-representation of black people in Wales prisons is a desperate failure
Calum: Liz SavilleRoberts : surely that is a desperate failure
Default Transition
Default Inference
Arguing
Liz SavilleRoberts : That is an indication of the racism in our society in action
the over-representation of black people in Wales prisons is an indication of the racism in our society in action
Asserting
Calum: Liz SavilleRoberts : That is an indication of the racism in our society in action
Default Transition
Default Inference
Arguing

Liz SavilleRoberts : Would you, as the Secretary of State for Justice, commit to using that as a target to reduce that percentage, specifically in Wales, but of course it applies through England and Wales entirely
Pure Questioning

Robert Buckland, as the Secretary of State for Justice, would or would not commit to using the over-representation of black people in prisons as a target to reduce that percentage, specifically in Wales, but of course it applies through England and Wales entirely

Calum: Liz SavilleRoberts : Would you, as the Secretary of State for Justice, commit to using that as a target to reduce that percentage, that unacceptable percentage within the prison population, specifically in Wales, but of course it applies through England and Wales entirely
Liz SavilleRoberts : that unacceptable percentage within the prison population
Asserting
black people make up an unacceptable percentage within the prison population
Calum: Liz SavilleRoberts : that unacceptable percentage within the prison population
Default Transition
Default Rephrase
Default Transition
Restating
Robert Buckland : what I commit to Liz, is making sure that the problems that are inherited by the criminal justice system, are dealt with further up the line
Asserting
Robert Buckland commits to making sure that the problems that are inherited by the criminal justice system, are dealt with further up the line
Calum: Robert Buckland : what I commit to Liz, is making sure that the problems that are inherited by the criminal justice system, are dealt with further up the line
Robert Buckland : the diversions that are needed in order to help people of that background, not to get into the system in the first place, are what we’re going to have to do
Asserting
the diversions that are needed in order to help people of a black background, not to get into the system in the first place, are what we’re going to have to do
Calum: Robert Buckland : the diversions that are needed in order to help people of that background, not to get into the system in the first place, are what we’re going to have to do
Default Rephrase

Robert Buckland : that’s not just me, that’s Education, that’s Health, that’s Housing, that’s the whole apparatus of government, in Wales and in Westminster, actually coming together around the problem and the individual, rather than this silo approach that means that I end up being responsible for a system with a disproportionate number of young people from that background within it
Asserting

not just Robert Buckland, that’s Education, that’s Health, that’s Housing, that’s the whole apparatus of government, in Wales and in Westminster, actually coming together around the problem and the individual, rather than this silo approach that means that Robert Buckland ends up being responsible for a prison system with a disproportionate number of young people from a black background within it
